blog.name: rollingstonemag
blog.title: RollingStone Magazine France
blog.description:
Musique, Livres, Cinéma, toute l'actualité culturelle passée au crible par la rédaction du magazine Rolling Stone !
http://www.rollingstone.fr/

summary: Un nouvel article a été publié sur https://www.rollingstone.fr/taylor-swift-contrat-universal/ Le nouveau contrat de Taylor...
caption:
Un nouvel article a été publié sur https://www.rollingstone.fr/taylor-swift-contrat-universal/

Le nouveau contrat de Taylor Swift devrait changer la donne pour beaucoup d'artistes

La chanteuse américaine Taylor Swift vient de conclure un marché avec Universal Music Group, notamment en ce qui concerne les revenus des artistes générés sur Spotify

Lundi dernier, lors de l’annonce de son nouveau deal avec Universal Music Group et Republic Records, Taylor Swift en a profité pour imposer une condition assez inattendue : en parallèle du contrat, UMG doit s’engager à remettre une part de l’énorme gâteau des revenus Spotify aux artistes, sur une base non-négociable.

Pas seulement à elle, mais à tous les artistes du label.

Une demande vaste, voire même un peu floue. Il y a quelques années, les trois grands labels – Universal, Sony et Warner – ont tous acheté des actions chez Spotify, chacun promettant tour à tour que les artistes bénéficieraient de l’investissement en cas de plus value auprès du géant du streaming suédois. En mars dernier, Universal (le dernier à s’être engagé) a annoncé que les artistes « auraient une part du gâteau » en cas de reventes de ses parts, en marge de l’introduction de Spotify à la Bourse de New York. Mais d’après certaines sources, le marché conclu avec Taylor Swift impliquerait une distribution des revenus auprès des artistes signés chez Universal totalement indépendante de leur statut – en d’autres termes, chaque artiste recevrait sa part même si ce dernier doit encore de l’argent au label. Une démarche que Sony a également enclenché suite à l’encaissement de parts investies dans Spotify, plus tôt dans l’année, mais pas Warner, dont les parts devraient revenir directement dans les caisses du label.

D’après ces mêmes sources proches de Rolling Stone US, cette concordance entre les exigences de la chanteuse et la méthode de paiement du PDG d’Universal Music Group, Sir Lucian Grainge, aurait largement contribué à concrétiser le deal. Si aucun chiffre n’a été dévoilé, invoquant la nature encore toute relative du deal, Taylor Swift a tenu à préciser que cette gestion des revenus était soumise à « de bien meilleures conditions » que chez Sony ou Warner.

« Dans le cadre de la signature de mon nouveau contrat avec Universal Music Group, j’ai demandé à ce que chaque revenu généré par leurs parts au sein de Spotify soit redistribué auprès de leurs artistes, sans que cela soit récupérable, » explique-t-elle dans un post Instagram. « Ce à quoi ils ont aimablement concédé, croyant fermement qu’il s’agit là de bien meilleures conditions de rémunération comparé au système des autres grands labels. » Elle ajoute que ces revenus Spotify « comptent plus pour moi que n’importe quel autre accord » d’un contrat qui lui donne également tous les droits sur ses futurs enregistrements bruts, et qu’il s’agit bien « d’un premier pas vers de meilleurs lendemains pour les créateurs – un but pour lequel je me battrai toujours, de quelle que manière que ce soit. »

Ce n’est pas la première fois que Taylor Swift se présente comme une des artistes les plus influentes auprès des grandes plates-formes de musique : elle exigea qu’Apple compense financièrement les artistes pendant la période d’essai d’Apple Music en 2015, et boycotta Spotify durant trois ans pour protester contre les revenus, quasi-inexistants, dégagés auprès des utilisateurs non-payants (sa discographie a fini par réapparaître l’été dernier).

Une démarche qui renforce un peu plus la place de l’artiste à l’ère du streaming, récupérant peu à peu les rênes d’une industrie encore majoritairement menée par les grandes maisons de disque. Gregor Pryor, avocat spécialiste de la musique, explique au Guardian que les prérogatives de Taylor Swift concernant les revenus versés aux artistes, malgré de potentielles dettes en cours, est un témoin fort d’une époque qui voit apparaître des artistes-businessmen, chose qui paraissait impossible il y a encore quelques années. « Jay-Z l’a fait avec Tidal… De nos jours, les artistes sont bien plus actifs dans la gestion de leurs investissements, à l’opposé de ce que la machine traditionnelle – aussi bien des labels que des diffuseurs – a pu leur proposer jusqu’à maintenant, » précise-t-il.

D’après Music Business Worldwide, dont le calcul se base sur un dépôt financier daté de 2008, les parts d’Universal dans Spotify s’élèveraient à 3,5%, représentant un milliard de dollars (plus de 870 millions d’euros) sur les 28 milliards (24,5 milliards d’euros) que représente actuellement la plate-forme de streaming sur le marché boursier.

Amy X. Wang
Traduit de l’anglais par Matthias Haghcheno

blog.name: messthatuwantedswift
blog.title: call it what you want
blog.description: Nav 🌸 | 20 | 💗 I love Taylor and that's all I really know 💗 | swiftie for life 💗 | I'm just a girl, trying to find a place in this world 💗 |

body: My Heart!

reblog.comment: My Heart!

trail.content_raw: My Heart!

tags: Yes this is what goes on in my head
summary: Okay, but imagine if Tay performed The Story of Us like this...
title: Okay, but imagine if Tay performed The Story of Us like this...
body: It starts off pitch black. Then, the sound of Taylor’s heels clicking against the stage floor, but she doesn’t appear just yet. A single spotlight appears at centre stage, shining at an empty table with a book on it, The Story Of Us, specifically. Taylor then appears, walking out from the back towards the table. She stares at the book and hesitates. A second later she opens the book. The opening drums of the song plays which scares her, she shuts the book, throwing it back on the table immediately. She stares at the book, not believing that just happened and so she tries again. The same thing occurs but this time she doesn’t throw it on the table but just holding shut instead. She looks at the crowd as if asking for approval to open the book once more. The crowd continues roaring as they have been since the beginning of the show and Tay will give out that smile/smirk she always does and opens the book and leaves it on the table. Lights turn on revealing the stage set up like a high school classroom similar to how it was in the MV itself. Of course she’ll have a male dancer playing the male lead role. She’ll be acting her part according to the lyrics acting out the cute fluffy moments as a couple and acting like she’s losing her mind like she did in the MV. Then it reaches the line “I’ve never heard silence quite this loud.” The music completely stops and her hair is messed up with her hands grasping her head and she’s kneeling on the floor. Then, she looks around for a moment before the sound of heavy breathing and heart beat starts appearing. The murmuring and usual chatter mixes in as her dancers start to file in on the stage, like students would in a hallway, then she starts becoming frantic again, gets up and runs to an empty part of the ‘crowded’ stage maybe up the stairs you see in the Speak Now Tour and the chorus hits again. During this time her dancers would act like as if they have just found out the gossip of Tay and the male lead’s relationship breakup/issue. When the instrumental bridge comes in Taylor descends the stairs and the dancers seem to have chosen sides, so she and the male lead come face to face with their own clique/army (whichever you wanna call it) and then here comes the bridge. Ya know, the part that goes all “this is looking like a contest of who can act like they care less” Yes that part and she’ll sing it like she’s the mature adult in the relationship, explaining to the guy. The guy then tries to start explaining, but no words come out and then their cliques just start up a fight and Tay just walks off on her own and the guy is just caught in between the sea of people. Taylor sings on until she reaches the last line,”and the story of us looks a lot like a tragedy now” and she just kinda gives off that look to the crowd like ‘what can I do about it’ shrugs with her palms up, a microphone in her right hand. Smiles, “The End.”

trail.content_raw: It starts off pitch black. Then, the sound of Taylor’s heels clicking against the stage floor, but she doesn’t appear just yet. A single spotlight appears at centre stage, shining at an empty table with a book on it, The Story Of Us, specifically. Taylor then appears, walking out from the back towards the table. She stares at the book and hesitates. A second later she opens the book. The opening drums of the song plays which scares her, she shuts the book, throwing it back on the table immediately. She stares at the book, not believing that just happened and so she tries again. The same thing occurs but this time she doesn’t throw it on the table but just holding shut instead. She looks at the crowd as if asking for approval to open the book once more. The crowd continues roaring as they have been since the beginning of the show and Tay will give out that smile/smirk she always does and opens the book and leaves it on the table. Lights turn on revealing the stage set up like a high school classroom similar to how it was in the MV itself. Of course she’ll have a male dancer playing the male lead role. She’ll be acting her part according to the lyrics acting out the cute fluffy moments as a couple and acting like she’s losing her mind like she did in the MV. Then it reaches the line “I’ve never heard silence quite this loud.” The music completely stops and her hair is messed up with her hands grasping her head and she’s kneeling on the floor. Then, she looks around for a moment before the sound of heavy breathing and heart beat starts appearing. The murmuring and usual chatter mixes in as her dancers start to file in on the stage, like students would in a hallway, then she starts becoming frantic again, gets up and runs to an empty part of the ‘crowded’ stage maybe up the stairs you see in the Speak Now Tour and the chorus hits again. During this time her dancers would act like as if they have just found out the gossip of Tay and the male lead’s relationship breakup/issue. When the instrumental bridge comes in Taylor descends the stairs and the dancers seem to have chosen sides, so she and the male lead come face to face with their own clique/army (whichever you wanna call it) and then here comes the bridge. Ya know, the part that goes all “this is looking like a contest of who can act like they care less” Yes that part and she’ll sing it like she’s the mature adult in the relationship, explaining to the guy. The guy then tries to start explaining, but no words come out and then their cliques just start up a fight and Tay just walks off on her own and the guy is just caught in between the sea of people. Taylor sings on until she reaches the last line,”and the story of us looks a lot like a tragedy now” and she just kinda gives off that look to the crowd like ‘what can I do about it’ shrugs with her palms up, a microphone in her right hand. Smiles, “The End.”

A single spotlight appears at centre stage, shining at an empty table with a book on it, The Story Of Us, specifically. Taylor then appears, walking out from the back towards the table. She stares at the book and hesitates. A second later she opens the book. The opening drums of the song plays which scares her, she shuts the book, throwing it back on the table immediately. She stares at the book, not believing that just happened and so she tries again. The same thing occurs but this time she doesn’t throw it on the table but just holding shut instead. She looks at the crowd as if asking for approval to open the book once more. The crowd continues roaring as they have been since the beginning of the show and Tay will give out that smile/smirk she always does and opens the book and leaves it on the table. Lights turn on revealing the stage set up like a high school classroom similar to how it was in the MV itself. Of course she’ll have a male dancer playing the male lead role. She’ll be acting her part according to the lyrics acting out the cute fluffy moments as a couple and acting like she’s losing her mind like she did in the MV. Then it reaches the line “I’ve never heard silence quite this loud.” The music completely stops and her hair is messed up with her hands grasping her head and she’s kneeling on the floor. Then, she looks around for a moment before the sound of heavy breathing and heart beat starts appearing. The murmuring and usual chatter mixes in as her dancers start to file in on the stage, like students would in a hallway, then she starts becoming frantic again, gets up and runs to an empty part of the ‘crowded’ stage maybe up the stairs you see in the Speak Now Tour and the chorus hits again. During this time her dancers would act like as if they have just found out the gossip of Tay and the male lead’s relationship breakup/issue. When the instrumental bridge comes in Taylor descends the stairs and the dancers seem to have chosen sides, so she and the male lead come face to face with their own clique/army (whichever you wanna call it) and then here comes the bridge. tags: she would be an amazing person to work for
who wouldn't want to pick her brain about the business and how she sees thing from a business perspective
it would be amazing as an up and coming artist
to see how she approaches things as an artist
either way I'm glad she's happy and she's going to kill us with the next chapter
summary: Maybe this is just me, but I would've loved to seen Taylor start her own record label. I mean think about it. Her name alone...
body:
Maybe this is just me, but I would’ve loved to seen Taylor start her own record label. I mean think about it. Her name alone would’ve had other artists come sign with her, not to mention she’s ridiculously talented. What up and coming artist wouldn’t want to learn from the best?

She’s always fighting for others. To ensure they’re treated fairly, and compensated for their work. She’s tireless, and never settles for anything but the best. She genuinely cares, and she’s always pushing herself to be the best person/musician she can be. When you’re working for a boss who’s passionate, driven, and cares about you as a person, that’s infectious. It makes you want to be better too.

summary: I had a weird dream I got lost at the end  of Rep tour and I asked for directions on how to get out and they just pointed to a...
body:
I had a weird dream I got lost at the end of Rep tour and I asked for directions on how to get out and they just pointed to a spiral staircase that went up and down, so I decided that they probably meant to go down so I walked down the stairs and I see Taylor sitting in her dressing room in a white bathrob eating chocolate chip cookies and telling someone where her favourite place to get them from is. I’m obviously starstruck so I just stand there watching Taylor eat these cookies then she suddenly notices me and I start panicking because this situation is fucking weird but I some manage to tell her I’m lost and she just smiles and offers me a cookie and I’m about to walk in and take one but then this security guard shouts at me “Hey your not meant to be down here” and starts running after me, because of seeing Taylor I am just running on pure adrenaline so I start running as well and as I’m running I just hear in the background from Taylor “No, bring cookie girl back.”

Then my boyfriend woke me up and honeslty I’m relieved to know that’s not how I meet Taylor if I ever do.
